name: General Knowledge Trivia Game | Mixed 10 Questions | 10 Questions

questions.text: Where is the Sea of Tranquility?
questions.explanation:
The Moon.

	The Sea of Tranquility is where Apollo 11 landed when it went to the moon.

questions.text: Who was the drummer of the Beatles?
questions.explanation:
Ringo Starr.

	Ringo Starr was just a stage name. His real name is Richard Starkey.

questions.text: How many outs are in an inning of baseball?
What does Kansas mean in the language of the Sioux Indians?
questions.explanation:
"People of the South Wind".

	In their language it means "People of the South Wind" and possibly it the reason it was named Kansas.

questions.text: Where does Freddy on Scooby Doo live?
questions.explanation:
123 Tuna Lane.

	Scooby Doo was created by Iwao Takamoto and first aired in the fall of 1969.

questions.text: On the TV show ED, who does Ed like?
questions.explanation:
Carol.

	Ed is a TV show on NBC and air on Fridays at 8:00 p.m. and used to air on Wednesdays at 7:00 p.m.  Ed liked Carol since they were little.  Ed got married and moved away, but then he got a divorce because he caught his wife with their mailman and now his is back in Stuckeyville and is in love with Carol, but at now there is Frankie that he is also in love with. So who knows what will happen.

questions.text: What year did the NFL begin?
questions.explanation:
1922.

	Some of the teams that were the first in the NFL were around before that date and played in a league known as the "American Professional Football Association", but the league was not known as the NFL until 1922.

questions.text: How long is one AU or Astronomical Unit?
questions.explanation:
93 million miles.

	One Astronomical Unit is the distance from the Earth to the Sun.

questions.text: Who was Lincoln's Secretary of State?
questions.explanation:
William Henry Seward.

	William Henry Seward almost didn't become Lincoln's Secretary of State, but at the last minute he accepted.

Comet.

	Encke's Comet is a very famous comet that last orbited the sun in 1996.
